sentence.Network_en: The massacre laid bare the moral bankruptcy of the regime.
sentence.Network_cn: 大屠杀使该政权的道德沦丧暴露无遗。

sentence.Network_en: The corporation is fighting to survive its second brush with bankruptcy.
sentence.Network_cn: 公司正在努力摆脱自身遭遇的第二次破产危机。

sentence.Network_en: The British East India Tea Company was overextended and faced bankruptcy.
sentence.Network_cn: 英国东印度茶业公司摊子大、开支多，已濒临破产。

entry.def: Bankruptcy is the state of being bankrupt.

example.ex: It is the second airline in two months to file for bankruptcy...
example.tran: 这是两个月内第二家申请破产的航空公司。

example.ex: Many established firms were facing bankruptcy.
example.tran: 许多成熟的企业正面临倒闭。

entry.def: A bankruptcy is an instance of an organization or person going bankrupt.

example.ex: The number of corporate bankruptcies climbed in August.

entry.def: If you refer to something's bankruptcy, you are emphasizing that it is completely lacking in value or worth.

example.ex: The massacre laid bare the moral bankruptcy of the regime.
example.tran: 大屠杀使该政权的道德沦丧暴露无遗。

means.word_mean: 1. a state of complete lack of some abstract property;
2. inability to discharge all your debts as they come due;

sentences.sentence: "fraudulent loans led to the failure of many banks"

means.word_mean: 3. a legal process intended to insure equality among the creditors of a corporation declared in bankruptcy

auth_sentence.content: If he does Chicago may be heading towards bankruptcy!

auth_sentence.res_content_con: If he does Chicago may be heading towards bankruptcy!

stems_affixes.word_buile: intrica=intricate复杂的+cy性质,状态→n.错综复杂

stems_affixes.value_cn: 突然的,出其不意的;[行为等]粗鲁无礼的
stems_affixes.word_buile: ab离开+rupt断裂→突然的[断开,离开]
bank银行+rupt断裂→adj.破产的;彻底缺乏的 v.使破产n.破产者
cor全部+rupt断→全部断→变坏的,腐败的
bank银行+rupt断裂→adj.破产的;彻底缺乏的 v.使破产n.破产者
corrupt[adj.腐败的;变环的]+ion表名词→n.腐化;腐坏;败坏
disrupt[v.使混乱,使崩溃,使分裂,使瓦解]+ion表名词→n.中断,分裂,瓦解,破坏
interrupt[v.中断,遮断,阻碍;打断[话],打扰]+ion表名词→n.中断,打断;障碍物

stems_affixes.value_cn: 破裂, 决裂, 敌对, 割裂
stems_affixes.word_buile: rupt断裂+ure→n.&v.破裂, 决裂, 敌对, 割裂
bank银行+rupt断裂→adj.破产的;彻底缺乏的 v.使破产n.破产者

stems_affixes.value_cn: 使混乱,使崩溃,使分裂,使瓦解
stems_affixes.word_buile: dis分开+rupt断裂→分开断→使崩溃,瓦解

stems_affixes.value_cn: 中断,遮断,阻碍;打断[话],打扰
stems_affixes.word_buile: inter在……中间+rupt断裂→讲话中间被打断

sentences.en: The company is on the brink of bankruptcy.
sentences.cn: 该公司已濒临于破产的边缘。

sentences.en: The firm will head toward bankruptcy unless a new manager is elected.
sentences.cn: 如果再不选出新的经理,这个公司就会破产。

sentences.en: The government has rescued the firm from bankruptcy by giving them a grant.
sentences.cn: 政府通过给企业贷款使他们免遭倒闭。
